ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to look through an analytic lens at nonfictional essays and become a stronger writer in different fields.
I really improved my writing skills.
Fantastic for building college level writing skills.
I learned reading and writing the modern essay by reading a lot of the different modern works by various authors and trying to replicate them in each of the five essays.

This was the second writing course I have taken at Yale and maybe one of my last exact English writing course. I feel that the knowledge I have gotten from this course is very useful and that my writing improved dramatically. I feel that the biggest change I noticed was the way the descriptive language I used within my writing grew and showed my own voice as the author more clearly.
I learned a lot of useful skills for crafting unique, creative essays in styles that I had never written before. I enjoyed the opportunity to write academic essays in a non-academic style.

I got a lot better at creative writing through reading lots of great work and having the opportunity to write and revise. I think my voice and tone improved dramatically over the course of the semester. Also, the process of writing about a topic or two that I sometimes got stuck on or had a hard time making interesting was really great practice in improving my writing ability.
Developed personal writing skills as well as specific stylistic techniques, like defamiliarization and extended lists.
strong understand if various forms of non fiction items.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: Close setting with a bunch of great people. My class offered an open space for constructive criticism and it was wonderful.
I thought the course was generally very well taught and organized.
Very well constructed and organized.
I think the course is fine as is. It is possible to select some more interesting readings, though.

I think this course is structured very well. The assignments are spaced out and we always have readings due to keep us busy. I also love the peer work and comments we wrote to each other because they really helped strengthen our writing and revision process. I think this course is over very strong.

Strength: the essays we read were all very good examples of the styles of essays we were trying to write. One major weakness was that the course jumped around so fast and it was difficult to focus on any given unit.

A huge strength of this course is the material we read. I loved almost every single thing we read, and the course really made me want to be a writer / english major (which I had not really even considered beforehand). I also love the way each class is formatted. Each class is centered around a discussion of what makes the essays we have read work, which was a very helpful and engaging way of improving our writing. I also really loved the workshops and getting to read others' writing and share my own. Everything about this course is great.
I thought this course had a very strong community. Everyone in the class gelled well together, and conversations were fun and productive.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, this is a great introductory class to college writing.
Yes for sure!
Absolutely. It has been one of the best courses I have taken at Yale.
Yes - great content.
Yes, please take this course with Professor Saraceni! She is a fantastic professor that gives good feedback and is very caring about her students.
I would recommend this course to another student. This is one of those courses that can be amazing for any student of any year or major.

Yes! ENGL 120 is a great chance to improve your writing and learn new styles of essays that are, in many ways, more relevant in the real world than a lot of the academic papers youll be writing for other classes

Out of all of the classes I have taken at Yale so far, this is the one I would recommend most highly. It was a fantastic introduction to writing at Yale for me. I really enjoyed all the essays we read, and I loved the process of writing and revising creative essays for the course.
I would recommend this course to anyone interested in becoming a better writer. The class can be difficult, but the feedback is useful and if you put effort in, it will be rewarded.
